text: A rich beef stew simmered with red chile and vegetables, traditionally served with corundas — savory corn dumplings wrapped in leaves. It’s a soulful dish that warms both body and spirit.
A comforting plate of white rice and beans topped with tomato sauce, cheese, and sometimes shredded meat. Simple, satisfying, and deeply rooted in local home cooking.
Tender corn tamales made from fresh maize, often served with cream and cheese. Their soft texture and subtle sweetness make them a beloved treat across Michoacán.
